description: The type field determines how to interpret the parameter.
title: A generic travel rule

_88maxSecurityParam.description: Paths with the least amount of systems with equal or higher security are preferred.
_88maxSecurityParam.title: The maximum security rule avoids systems with equal or higher security

___limit.title: The first security value to avoid

$eref.description: 0 has the highest priority. Only if a rule determines two paths equal, the rule with the next lower priority will be considered.
$eref.title: The priority of the rule

_88transitCountParam.description: Paths with fewer transit systems are preferred.
_88transitCountParam.title: The transit count rule considers the amount of solar systems

$eref.description: 0 has the highest priority. Only if a rule determines two paths equal, the rule with the next lower priority will be considered.
$eref.title: The priority of the rule

_88rulePriority.description: 0 has the highest priority. Only if a rule determines two paths equal, the rule with the next lower priority will be considered.
_88rulePriority.title: The priority of the rule

_88minSecurityParam.description: Paths with the least amount of systems with lower security are preferred.
_88minSecurityParam.title: The minimum security rule avoids systems with lower security

___limit.title: The lowest acceptable security value a solar system should have

$eref.description: 0 has the highest priority. Only if a rule determines two paths equal, the rule with the next lower priority will be considered.
$eref.title: The priority of the rule

_88jumpDistanceParam.description: Paths with the least usage of jump drives are preferred.
_88jumpDistanceParam.title: The jump distance rule helps minimize jump fuel cost
